title: Mango Tree
summary: The King of Fruits, Mango trees are perfect for gardens and farms.
metaDescription: Buy Mango Tree (Mangifera indica) – the king of fruits. A tropical evergreen tree that grows well in warm climates. Perfect for home gardens and orchards.

specifications.label: Water
specifications.value: Moderate, allow soil to dry slightly

details: The Mango Tree (Mangifera indica) is a tropical evergreen admired for its sweet, juicy fruits. It grows well in warm climates with full sun exposure. Beyond fruits, its lush canopy provides excellent shade, making it a multifunctional addition to gardens and orchards.
description: Known as the 'King of Fruits,' the Mango tree is cherished worldwide for its delicious harvest. With proper care and space, it thrives in gardens and farmlands, offering both shade and seasonal fruit. A perfect choice for tropical landscaping and backyard orchards.

faqs.question: When will a mango tree start fruiting?
faqs.answer: Typically within 3-5 years depending on the variety and growing conditions.

faqs.question: Does it need full sunlight?
faqs.answer: Yes, mango trees need at least 6-8 hours of direct sunlight daily.

title: Guava Tree
summary: A hardy fruit tree producing delicious, vitamin-rich guavas.
metaDescription: Buy Guava Tree (Psidium guajava) – a hardy, low-maintenance fruit tree producing vitamin-rich guavas. Ideal for gardens and farms.
details: The Guava Tree (Psidium guajava) is a fast-growing, low-maintenance fruit tree. It produces nutrient-rich guavas, packed with Vitamin C. Adaptable to different soils, it thrives in full sun and makes an excellent choice for small gardens.
description: Guava trees are a favorite for Indian gardens due to their adaptability and nutritious fruits. They grow quickly, require minimal care, and can yield fruits within 2-3 years, making them ideal for home growers.

faqs.question: How soon does a guava tree bear fruit?
faqs.answer: Usually within 2-3 years after planting.

faqs.question: Can guava grow in pots?
faqs.answer: Yes, dwarf varieties can grow in large pots.

title: Rose Plant
summary: The timeless symbol of love, admired for its beauty and fragrance.
metaDescription: Buy Rose Plant – an all-time favorite flowering plant with stunning blooms and rich fragrance. Perfect for gardens, patios, and gifting.
details: The Rose Plant (Rosa spp.) is a classic garden favorite, producing vibrant flowers in various colors. It needs sunlight, regular watering, and occasional pruning to bloom year-round.
description: Roses are beloved for their beauty and fragrance, symbolizing love and elegance. Ideal for gardens, balconies, or as potted plants, they thrive with sunlight and care, rewarding you with spectacular blooms.

faqs.question: How often should I water roses?
faqs.answer: Water 2-3 times a week depending on climate.

faqs.question: Do roses need pruning?
faqs.answer: Yes, pruning encourages healthier growth and more blooms.

title: Hibiscus Plant
summary: Bright tropical blooms, perfect for hedges and borders.
metaDescription: Buy Hibiscus Plant (Hibiscus rosa-sinensis) – a tropical flowering plant with large, vibrant blooms. Ideal for gardens and hedges.
details: The Hibiscus Plant (Hibiscus rosa-sinensis) is prized for its large, colorful flowers. Easy to grow and maintain, it adds a tropical touch to any garden. It thrives in sunlight and blooms year-round in warm climates.
description: Hibiscus plants are ideal for hedges, garden borders, and decorative pots. Their striking blooms also attract pollinators like butterflies and hummingbirds, making them eco-friendly additions to gardens.

faqs.question: Do hibiscus plants bloom all year?
faqs.answer: Yes, in tropical climates with proper care.

faqs.question: Can hibiscus grow indoors?
faqs.answer: Yes, but it needs bright light and warmth.

title: Neem Tree
summary: A medicinal tree providing shade and natural remedies.
metaDescription: Buy Neem Tree (Azadirachta indica) – a traditional Indian tree known for shade, medicinal uses, and air purification.
details: The Neem Tree (Azadirachta indica) is a sacred Indian tree known for its medicinal value and shade-giving canopy. Hardy and drought-resistant, it is suitable for roadside planting and large gardens.
description: Neem is widely used in Ayurveda and home remedies. Its presence purifies air, offers dense shade, and promotes ecological balance, making it a must-have tree in Indian landscapes.

faqs.question: Is neem drought-resistant?
faqs.answer: Yes, it thrives even in low water conditions.

faqs.question: Does neem repel pests?
faqs.answer: Yes, neem leaves and oil are natural pesticides.

title: Ashoka Tree
summary: A tall evergreen tree providing dense shade and beauty.
metaDescription: Buy Ashoka Tree (Saraca asoca) – a sacred and ornamental evergreen tree with dense shade and medicinal properties.
details: The Ashoka Tree (Saraca asoca) is a sacred evergreen admired for its ornamental beauty and medicinal value. It offers dense shade and thrives in Indian climates.
description: Widely planted in temples and gardens, the Ashoka tree holds cultural and spiritual significance. Its elegant leaves and clusters of flowers enhance landscapes, while also providing eco-benefits.

faqs.question: Is Ashoka tree good for roadside planting?
faqs.answer: Yes, it provides dense shade and grows upright.

faqs.question: Does Ashoka tree have medicinal use?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is used in Ayurveda for women’s health.

title: Tulsi Plant
summary: A sacred Ayurvedic herb known for healing and immunity.
metaDescription: Buy Tulsi Plant (Holy Basil – Ocimum sanctum) – a sacred and medicinal herb, widely used in Ayurveda for immunity and wellness.
details: The Tulsi Plant (Ocimum sanctum) is revered in Indian households for its spiritual and medicinal value. Easy to grow in pots or gardens, it thrives with sunlight and moderate watering.
description: Tulsi leaves are used in Ayurveda and home remedies for cough, cold, and immunity. Considered sacred, it is often grown near homes and temples as a purifier and healer.

faqs.question: How often should Tulsi be watered?
faqs.answer: Water daily in summer and alternate days in winter.

faqs.question: Can Tulsi grow indoors?
faqs.answer: Yes, near a sunny window.

title: Curry Leaf Plant
summary: A must-have aromatic herb for Indian kitchens.
metaDescription: Buy Curry Leaf Plant (Murraya koenigii) – an aromatic herb used in Indian cooking for flavor and fragrance.
details: The Curry Leaf Plant (Murraya koenigii) is an aromatic herb essential in Indian cooking. It grows easily in pots and gardens, requiring moderate care.
description: Curry leaves add authentic flavor to Indian curries and dals. Fresh leaves can be plucked directly from the plant, making it a kitchen garden favorite.

faqs.question: How soon can I start harvesting curry leaves?
faqs.answer: Within 1 year of planting.

faqs.question: Does it grow in pots?
faqs.answer: Yes, it grows well in large pots with drainage.

title: Fiddle Leaf Fig
summary: A stylish large-leaf plant perfect for modern interiors.
metaDescription: Buy Fiddle Leaf Fig (Ficus lyrata) – a trendy indoor plant with large violin-shaped leaves. Ideal for homes, offices, and modern décor.
details: The Fiddle Leaf Fig (Ficus lyrata) is one of the most popular indoor plants worldwide, known for its large, glossy, violin-shaped leaves. This tropical beauty adds instant drama and sophistication to any space, making it a favorite for homes, offices, and modern interiors.
description: Often featured in interior design magazines, the Fiddle Leaf Fig is a statement piece for modern décor. With proper care, it grows tall and sculptural, becoming the centerpiece of any space. It requires moderate care but rewards with unmatched beauty.

faqs.question: Is it beginner-friendly?
faqs.answer: It needs moderate care, so best for plant lovers with some experience.

faqs.question: How often to repot?
faqs.answer: Every 1-2 years when roots outgrow the pot.

title: Areca Palm
summary: A graceful palm that enhances interiors and purifies air.
metaDescription: Buy Areca Palm (Dypsis lutescens) – an elegant indoor/outdoor palm that improves air quality and adds tropical charm.
details: The Areca Palm (Dypsis lutescens) is an elegant tropical palm perfect for indoor decoration. It thrives in bright, indirect light and doubles as a natural air purifier.
description: Ideal for living rooms, offices, and patios, the Areca Palm adds freshness and greenery. Low-maintenance and visually appealing, it is a popular choice for modern homes and workplaces.

faqs.question: Is Areca Palm safe for pets?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is non-toxic to cats and dogs.

faqs.question: Does Areca Palm need sunlight?
faqs.answer: It prefers bright indirect light but tolerates low light.

title: Banana Plant
summary: A fast-growing tropical plant producing clusters of sweet bananas.
metaDescription: Banana Plant – tropical fruit plant that grows quickly and yields bunches of sweet bananas.
details: The Banana Plant is iconic for its large leaves and delicious fruit. It is fast-growing, requires minimal maintenance, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions.
description: Known for its sweet fruit, the banana plant is also ornamental due to its lush green leaves. Ideal for kitchen gardens, farms, and landscapes with warm climates.

title: Orange Tree
summary: A citrus tree producing sweet and tangy oranges, loved worldwide.
metaDescription: Orange Tree – medium-sized fruit tree producing juicy oranges. Perfect for gardens and orchards.
details: The Orange Tree is one of the most popular fruit trees worldwide. It thrives in warm climates and produces sweet, tangy fruits rich in Vitamin C. Its glossy leaves and fragrant blossoms make it a garden favorite.
description: Orange trees are valued for both their beauty and fruit production. With proper care, they provide abundant harvests and are a staple in home gardens and orchards alike.

title: Apple Tree
summary: A popular fruit tree producing crisp, sweet, or tart apples in many varieties.
metaDescription: Apple Tree – classic fruit tree that produces sweet and tart apples. Ideal for orchards and gardens in temperate climates.
details: Apple trees are a staple in temperate regions, producing fruits that are consumed fresh, cooked, or juiced. With proper care, they can yield fruit for decades.
description: Apple trees add beauty to gardens with their blossoms and are among the most rewarding fruit trees to grow, offering a wide variety of delicious fruits.

title: Papaya Tree
summary: A fast-growing tropical tree producing sweet, orange-fleshed papayas.
metaDescription: Papaya Tree – tropical fruit tree producing sweet and nutritious papayas. Grows quickly with minimal care.
details: The Papaya Tree is a short-lived, fast-growing tropical plant. It bears fruit within a year of planting, making it highly popular for kitchen gardens and commercial cultivation.
description: Known for its sweet, juicy fruit, papaya is rich in vitamins and digestive enzymes. It is a favorite choice for tropical home gardens.

title: Pomegranate Tree
summary: A hardy fruit tree producing juicy, ruby-red pomegranates full of antioxidants.
metaDescription: Pomegranate Tree – easy-to-grow fruit tree producing antioxidant-rich pomegranates. Thrives in warm climates.
details: Pomegranate trees are highly ornamental with their bright flowers and nutritious fruits. They thrive in hot, dry climates and require little maintenance.
description: The pomegranate is a symbol of prosperity and health. Its fruits are loved worldwide, both fresh and juiced, and the tree is resilient in many conditions.
